0.title: Tamil Nadu girl held for raising anti-BJP slogans gets ₹2 lakh compensation
0.article_body: Tamil Nadu's State Human Rights Commission (SHRC) has ordered payment of ₹2 lakh as compensation to a Canada-based girl student from the state. The girl was arrested for raising anti-BJP government slogans on a flight in which the then BJP state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan was a co-passenger in 2018. "Money be recovered from police personnel who arrested her," SHRC ordered.

1.title: Putin will go for blood beyond Ukraine, he wants a new Russian empire: Ukraine
1.article_body: Andriy Yermak, the head of the Presidential Office of Ukraine, has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin will "go for blood beyond Ukraine", adding, "He must be stopped." He further said that Putin wants to create a new Russian empire. Russia's war with Ukraine "could be a prologue to a greater European or even global massacre", he stated.

2.title: This may be the last time you see me alive, Zelenskyy told EU leaders on video: Report
2.article_body: An EU official has told Reuters that Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's concluding message to EU leaders' online emergency summit after Russia began invasion was, "This may be the last time you see me alive." Dressed in army fatigues, Zelenskyy was reportedly speaking from a bunker. Another official said, "There was a stunned silence and some had tears in their eyes."

3.title: India focussed on 2 things, we urge India to take clear position: US on Russian invasion
3.article_body: The US administration is trying to urge India to take a "clear position" on the Russia-Ukraine crisis, US diplomat Donald Lu said. "India has focused on two things when trying to explain its position. The possibility of a diplomatic resolution of this conflict. The second thing that they emphasise is India has 18,000 students still in Ukraine," he added.

4.title: 4,800 Indian students to be evacuated from Romania by Friday: Scindia
4.article_body: Around 4,800 Indian students will be evacuated from Bucharest and Suceava in Romania through 24 flights between Wednesday and Friday amid the Russia-Ukraine war, Jyotiraditya Scindia, Union Minister for Civil Aviation, said. India has been evacuating its citizens through special flights from Ukraine's western neighbours. On Wednesday, Scindia interacted with the Indian students in Bucharest.

5.title: Hospitals in Ukraine running out of oxygen amid war: WHO
5.article_body: The WHO warned that hospitals in Ukraine are running out of oxygen supplies amid the ongoing war.  "Critical shortages of oxygen will...impact...the ability to treat patients with COVD-19 and...other conditions," WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said. "At least three major oxygen plants in Ukraine have now closed and we're seeking ways of accessing oxygen from neighbouring nations," he added.

6.title: Noida Police retains top spot across UP in 112 response for 8th month in row
6.article_body: The Gautam Buddh Nagar Police has bagged the top spot in Uttar Pradesh for the month of February in terms of response time to emergency calls on the 112 service, official data showed. The response time was at 6.32 minutes in February, as per the data. The district has retained top spot among 75 districts in UP since July 2021.

7.title: 4 arrested with unaccounted gold worth ₹16 crore on Konark Express
7.article_body: Four people were detained by Government Railway Police (GRP) on Mumbai-Bhubaneswar Konark Express on Wednesday. The GRP became suspicious of the movement of the four accused and checked their luggage. They seized 32 kg of unaccounted gold worth ₹16 crore from their possession. The accused couldn't produce valid GST documents of the seized gold jewellery during investigation, GRP official said.

8.title: 6,000 people fined ₹3.31 crore for not wearing helmets in Pune
8.article_body: A total of 6,000 people were fined in Pune for riding their two-wheelers without a helmet in the first two months of this year, officials said. A fine of ₹3.31 crore has been collected from the violators. According to reports, the Pune Police department had collected ₹90 crore in fines from 18 lakh helmet-less riders in 2021.

9.title: Govt launches 'Stree Manoraksha Project' to improve women's mental health
9.article_body: Ministry of Women and Child Development (MoWCD) launched the 'Stree Manoraksha Project' in collaboration with NIMHANS Bengaluru on Wednesday. The project aims at improving mental health of women by enhancing the One-Stop Centres (OSC) across India. "New initiatives...will equip OSC functionaries with better understanding & resources to assist distressed women," WCD Minister Smriti Irani tweeted.

10.title: Never showed hand to any astrologer: Prabhas on playing palmist in Radhe Shyam
10.article_body: When asked if he believes in astrology, Prabhas, who'll portray the role of a palmist in 'Radhe Shyam', said he believes in "faith". "I never showed hand to any palmist," he added. "When I heard the story, I was surprised to get an offer to play a palmist in the film...It is a fight between love and destiny," Prabhas said.

11.title: Ukraine Prez urges Jews to speak up after Russia bombs Holocaust site
11.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy exhorted Jews to speak up after the Russians reportedly bombed Holocaust massacre site Babyn Yar in Kyiv killing five people. "Don't you see what is happening? Millions of Jews around the world, do not stay silent. Because Nazism is born in silence. Scream about murdering of civilians, scream about murdering of Ukrainians." he said.

12.title: Policeman shoots 12-year-old dead in US’ Philadelphia
12.article_body: The US' Philadelphia police shot dead a 12-year-old boy after a bullet hit their unmarked car. The police said they were in the area responding to some social media posts about a gun. One of the officers reportedly chased down the boy, who they claimed was fleeing carrying a gun, and shot him in the back.

13.title: Ukraine-returnee's family welcomes her in Delhi with flowers, feeds her
13.article_body: Family of Indian student who returned from Ukraine amid the Russia-Ukraine crisis, welcomed her at Delhi airport. The family welcomed the girl, Ujjala Gupta, with garland and showered flowers on her. She was also fed at the airport. "I request the government to bring back the students stuck in Kyiv and Kharkiv as the situation there is serious," Ujjala said.

14.title: Premier League captains to wear armbands in Ukrainian colours to show support
14.article_body: Premier League captains will wear armbands in Ukrainian colours this weekend to show support for the country amid Russia's invasion. "The 20 club captains will wear special armbands...Big screens at stadiums will display 'Football Stands Together' against the backdrop of the blue and yellow colours of the Ukrainian flag," Premier League said in a statement.

15.title: Average temperatures rising across seasons since 1991: IMD
15.article_body: Average temperatures across seasons have seen a sharp upward trend in the country since 1991, according to IMD. The trend is in comparison to the average surface air temperature baseline recorded between 1981 and 2010. Heat waves associated with abnormally high temperatures over certain areas are also on a rise across the country.

16.title: 8-yr-old practising acrobatics in room accidentally hangs self with ribbons in Argentina
16.article_body: An eight-year-old girl died in Argentina allegedly after accidentally hanging herself while practising acrobatics with fabric ribbons in her bedroom. Her parents reportedly found her hanging from the fabric and tried to revive her. "It is not goodbye, it is see you soon Laylita. We are going to miss you a lot, Princess," her family wrote on social media.

17.title: Google to open some US, UK, Asia Pacific offices for 3 days/week in April
17.article_body: Google will require most employees in some of its US, UK and Asia Pacific offices to work from office three days a week from April 4, Reuters reported. Everyone coming to office will have to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or have approved exemption. All fully-vaccinated employees won't have to wear masks in San Francisco Bay Area offices.

18.title: Don't want to criticise but govt lagging behind in Ukraine evacuation: Mamata
18.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the Central government over the evacuation of citizens from war-hit Ukraine and said that it is "lagging behind on matters of external affairs". "I don't want to criticise the government on matters of external affairs. But...we are lagging behind on this matter because of some coordination gap and political businesses," Banerjee said.

19.title: Amazon may file criminal case over Future's transfer of stores to Reliance: Report
19.article_body: Amazon is reportedly planning to initiate criminal court proceedings against Future Retail for allowing the transfer of assets to Reliance Industries. Earlier, Reuters reported that Mukesh Ambani-led RIL had started taking over 500 of Future's stores. The development came amid Future's ongoing legal battle with Amazon over its ₹24,713-crore sale of retail assets to RIL.

20.title: UAE suspends visa-free travel for Ukrainians as thousands flee war
20.article_body: The United Arab Emirates has temporarily suspended a visa waiver for Ukrainian citizens, Kyiv's embassy in UAE said, as thousands of Ukrainians flee Russia's invading army. "It's actually a crime...if they don't let Ukrainians enter the country right now and require a visa. How should they get a visa at this moment, it's impossible," a Ukrainian woman in Dubai said.

21.title: Christian pastor claims mob assaulted him over forced conversions in Delhi
21.article_body: A 35-year-old Christian pastor has claimed that he was allegedly tied up and assaulted by a mob accusing him of conducting forced religious conversions in Delhi's Fatehpur Beri on February 25. The mob allegedly tied the man to a road divider and forced him to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' when he was going to the church.

22.title: Which countries supported Russia at UN General Assembly session on Ukraine conflict?
22.article_body: Other than Russia, four countries voted against UN General Assembly resolution that demanded Russia "immediately, completely and unconditionally" withdraw its military forces from Ukraine. Belarus, North Korea, Eritrea and Syria voted against the resolution. A total of 141 countries voted in favour of the resolution, while 35 countries including India abstained from voting.

23.title: Video shows Russian soldier breaking down as Ukrainians give him tea, help him call mom
23.article_body: A video has been widely shared on social media purportedly showing a Russian soldier breaking down as Ukrainians gave him tea and food after he surrendered. In the video, Ukrainians can be seen helping him video call his mother. The soldier is seen breaking down as his mother tells him, "Everything will be okay, my son."

24.title: Not just India, Kohli left legacy for world cricket as Test captain: Karthik
24.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has said the intensity with which India has played Test cricket under Virat Kohli in the last couple of years has been phenomenal. Karthik added, "I don't think Virat has left a legacy just for Indian cricket, he has left it for world cricket." He further said, "Virat brought fitness to the table...and made that a mandate."

25.title: It's my same handsome self: SRK to fan who asked him to reveal his Pathaan look
25.article_body: During an AMA session on Twitter, a fan asked Shah Rukh Khan when was he going to reveal his look from 'Pathaan', the actor replied, "I look the same...since 32 years now...What look...it’s [my] same...handsome self." Speaking about returning to the sets of a film, Shah Rukh wrote, "Set is where I belong. So it was like going back home."

26.title: 12-time champion Rafael Nadal set to play Barcelona Open in April
26.article_body: Barcelona Open tournament organisers on Wednesday said 12-time winner Rafael Nadal is set to play the Barcelona Open in April. Nadal will try to defend his title which he won in 2021, beating Stefanos Tsitsipas in the final. The Barcelona Open and Roland Garros are the two tournaments where Nadal has won at least 12 times in his career.

27.title: Russia keeps Indian Flag intact, covers US, UK, Japan flags on space rocket
27.article_body: A video showing Russia covering flags of US, Japan and UK, and leaving Indian Flag intact on a space rocket has gone viral. US, UK and Japan have imposed sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. "The launchers...decided that without the flags of some countries, our rocket would look more beautiful," Russian space agency ROSCOSMOS' chief Dmitry Rogozin said.

28.title: Walls in my chawl were so old that colours used to vanish: Bhansali
28.article_body: Talking about his experience while living in a chawl, filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said the walls in his chawl were so old that the colours used to vanish the moment the walls were coloured. "During my childhood, I used to pursue art in my homework and while painting the colourless walls," added Bhansali.

29.title: 167 held after communal clash in K'taka's Kalaburagi, Sec 144 extended till March 5
29.article_body: At least 167 people were arrested following a communal clash in Aland in Karnataka's Kalaburagi. A right-wing Hindu group had announced an event on Maha Shivaratri to purify a 'shivalinga' allegedly located on a dargah's premises and Muslim groups had planned a procession there the same day. Police imposed Section 144 anticipating unrest and have extended it till March 5.

30.title: I'm a strong guy but I might faint on meeting Big B: Actor Surya Sharma
30.article_body: Actor Surya Sharma said that even though he is a "very strong guy", he "might surely faint" the day he meets actor Amitabh Bachchan. "I loved Bachchan saab's angry young man characters from Zanjeer, Agneepath and Sharaabi. All these characters from these films touched my heart. He has been my inspiration," he added.

31.title: We broke Russia’s years of planning in a week: Ukraine Prez
31.article_body: Addressing the citizens in a Telegram video, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "We are a nation that broke the enemy's [Russia's] plans in a week. Plans written for years: sneaky, full of hatred for our country, our people." "I sincerely admire the Ukrainians who go out with their bare hands and chase the occupiers out of their cities," he added.

32.title: Man arrested in Ahmedabad for murder of Kolkata businessman
32.article_body: A person was arrested in Ahmedabad in connection with the murder of a city-based businessman, the Kolkata Police said. Police received a complaint that an unknown person had called the complainant to say that the businessman was kidnapped. However, when the businessman didn't return after his family paid the ransom, a search was conducted and later his body was recovered.

33.title: 3 Africans arrested in Chandigarh for ₹8 lakh customs duty fraud
33.article_body: Three African nationals were arrested by police for duping a man of ₹8.72 lakh in customs duty fraud in Chandigarh. They allegedly befriended him through a fake Facebook profile and said he'd receive a gift from UK. One of the accused, posing as a customs duty official later tricked him into paying customs fees for the parcel in multiple instalments.

34.title: Regret projecting a controversial image to gain fame: Poonam Pandey
34.article_body: Admitting that she regrets projecting a controversial image in public "big time", actress-model Poonam Pandey said she believed she could gain fame that way after being told so by people. "Now that I am presenting my real self, everyone is shocked why I portrayed something else. I have...made mistakes, got beaten up and...want to change the world's opinion," added Poonam.

35.title: Leadership never goes, but I feel Kohli will be more productive now: Gavaskar
35.article_body: With Virat Kohli set to play his first Test after stepping down as captain in Mohali against Sri Lanka, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the 33-year-old is going to be more productive than he has been in the past couple of years. "The leader in you never goes...But he's also going to be concentrating more on his batting," Gavaskar stated.

36.title: BMC to modernise dispensaries, provide telemedicine facilities
36.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will upgrade 10 dispensaries in the city by April. The dispensaries will be equipped with in-house diagnostic centres, telemedicine facilities and visits by super specialists from major hospitals. The transformation of the dispensaries is part of the BMC's strategy to establish 100 polyclinics and diagnostic centres across the city.

37.title: Admissions closing for Jigsaw, IIM-I’s online Product Management Program
37.article_body: Admissions are closing soon for Jigsaw & IIM Indore's 6th batch of online Product Management program. The 6-month program seeks to enable participants to go through the complete product life cycle & master Product Management phases. It offers a 5i Framework-based curriculum with Harvard Business Case-studies & BYOP feature, Jigsaw said, adding it's an ideal choice for next-gen product leaders.

38.title: Over 45,000 homeless, beggars vaccinated in Delhi: Govt tells SC
38.article_body: The Delhi government informed Supreme Court that as of February 27 over 45,000 people without identity cards, including homeless people and beggars, were vaccinated in the city. It was replying to a petition seeking COVID-19 vaccination for such people across the country. Further, over 3 crore doses have been administered in Delhi to people aged 15 and above, government added.

39.title: India reports 6,561 new COVID-19 cases, nearly 1,000 cases less than yesterday
39.article_body: India has reported 6,561 new COVID-19 cases and 142 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 7,554 cases and 223 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 77,152, while the death toll in the country reached 5,14,388. Over 4.2 crore people have recovered so far.

40.title: I had a lot of tears for many days: Melinda on divorce with Bill Gates
40.article_body: Melinda French Gates, during a CBS interview, opened up about her divorce with Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates after 27 years of marriage. "I had a lot of tears for many days...days where I'm literally laying on the floor...thinking, 'How can this be? How can I get up?" she said. According to Melinda, there were also days when she was "angry".

41.title: World's largest yacht worth ₹4,500 cr seized by Germany from Russian billionaire: Reports
41.article_body: German authorities have reportedly seized the $600-million superyacht belonging to Russian billionaire Alisher Usmanov in a Hamburg shipyard. The 512-foot yacht named Dilbar is the world’s largest motor yacht by gross tonnage at 15,917 tons. Usmanov was on a list of billionaires to face sanctions from European Union in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

42.title: Ukraine shares map showing countries that closed their airspace to Russian planes
42.article_body: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine took to Twitter to share a map showing countries that have closed their airspace to Russian planes. Apart from the European Union countries, Albania, Canada, Iceland, Moldova, North Macedonia, Montenegro, Norway, United Kingdom, USA and Switzerland have closed their airspace to Russia amid its invasion of Ukraine.

43.title: Youth rejecting caste-based leaders who are filling their family coffers: PM
43.article_body: Now people vote for their development and the development of the state and the country, PM Narendra Modi said. "I am also very satisfied that the youth are aware and understanding and they are continuously rejecting caste-based leaders who are just filling their family coffers," PM Modi added.

44.title: 51-yr-old man gets 4-year jail for molesting teenager in Mohali
44.article_body: A 51-year-old man was convicted to four years in jail for molesting a 15-year-old girl at Kambali village in Mohali. The incident took place in 2015 when the girl was studying in class 9. In her complaint, she had said Balraj Kumar, a general store owner, touched her inappropriately while she was on her way to school in November 2015.

45.title: 24-year-old man arrested for robbing bank employee in Pune
45.article_body: Pune City Police have arrested a 24-year-old man for allegedly robbing a bank employee of ₹67,000. Rohit Pawar was on a motorcycle when the accused and his accomplice intercepted him near Swargate bus depot. The duo then reportedly took Pawar to Mukund Nagar, thrashed him, took his PhonePe password, and transferred ₹67,000 to the bank account of the accused.

46.title: Russia's rating cut to 'junk' by Fitch & Moody's amid sanctions
46.article_body: Global rating agencies Fitch and Moody's have each cut Russia's sovereign credit rating by six notches to "junk" status after the country's invasion of Ukraine. Western sanctions imposed on Russia could undermine its capability and willingness to service debt, they said. Meanwhile, index providers FTSE Russell and MSCI announced that they will remove Russian equities from all their indexes.

47.title: I questioned myself after toxic relationships, friends showed me mirror: Neha
47.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia said that she has been in "toxic relationships". "I questioned myself...I have had so many [friends] who were not from the business and I still have them...and it's just like...here's the mirror, this is the reality and this is what you have a mirror for, not for vanity. So yeah, I have been okay," Neha said.

48.title: Don’t shoot people, let us collect bodies: Kherson mayor to Russian forces
48.article_body: The mayor of Ukraine's Kherson confirmed that the port city has been overrun by Russian troops. When the Russians reached the city administration building, Mayor Igor Kolykhaev urged them not to shoot civilians. "I simply asked them not to shoot at people," he said. He also asked them to allow them to collect the bodies from the streets.

49.title: Not the type of wicket I would have produced: Lyon on Rawalpindi pitch
49.article_body: Talking about the wicket for the first Test against Pakistan in Rawalpindi, Australia spinner Nathan Lyon said, "It's similar to UAE wicket...there isn't much grass." He added, "Expecting it to be pretty nice to bat on the first couple of days." Lyon, however, also stated that it's not the type of wicket he would have produced as a curator.

50.title: Trans students enrolled for HSC, SSC exams highest in Mumbai division
50.article_body: The Maharashtra state board has received total 229 applications of transgender students to appear for the HSC, SSC exams, out of which 42 applications are from Mumbai division, the highest number in Maharashtra. As per the data, 40 will appear from Nashik, 37 from Pune and 35 from Aurangabad division. The section for transgender students was first introduced in 2019.

51.title: Hyd's Cyberabad Police busts plan to assassinate T'gana minister, 8 held
51.article_body: Cyberabad Police busted a conspiracy to assassinate Telangana Tourism and Excise Minister V Srinivas Goud and arrested eight persons in connection with the case. Three of the accused were arrested in Delhi and brought to Hyderabad, Cyberabad Commissioner of Police Stephen Raveendra said. Their location was traced and found to be BJP leader AP Jithender Reddy's servant quarters, police added.

52.title: No such report received: Govt as Russia says Indians held hostage by Ukrainians
52.article_body: The Indian government has released a statement after Russian Defence Ministry alleged that Ukrainian forces are keeping a large group of Indian students as "hostages". "We note that with the cooperation of the Ukrainian authorities, many students have left Kharkiv yesterday. We have not received any reports of any hostage situation regarding any student," the government said.

53.title: Time to decide between BJP & terror-supporting people: UP CM Yogi
53.article_body: On the day of polling for the sixth phase of UP Assembly polls, CM Yogi Adityanath on Thursday said that the elections have reached the decisive stage and each vote to BJP is a step towards making UP India's number one economy. "It is time to decide between us and terror-supporting people," CM Yogi said.

54.title: Apple to host its 1st event of 2022 'Peek Performance' on March 8
54.article_body: Apple will be hosting its first event of 2022, called 'Peek Performance', on March 8. The event will be a digital-only gathering with no members of the media invited to attend in person. Apple is reportedly expected to launch the next-generation version of the iPhone SE, a revamped iPad Air, and a high-end Mac Mini.

55.title: No one can take away Muslims’ voting rights in India: Tejashwi Yadav
55.article_body: Days after Bihar BJP MLA Haribhushan Thakur said Muslims in India should live like second-class citizens, Leader of Opposition Tejashwi Yadav responded by saying, "No 'Mai ka laal' (son of a mother) can take away the voting rights of Muslims." "Shahnawaz bhai, your citizenship is at stake," he added, pointing towards BJP minister Syed Shahnawaz Hussain.

56.title: MU library shifting to new building, to be operational by March 15: Min
56.article_body: The Jawaharlal Nehru Library of Mumbai University will be shifting to the new library building by March 15, said state Higher and Technical Education Minister Uday Samant. Earlier, the minister visited the library located in Mumbai University's Kalina campus which has come under the scanner for its poor condition, putting books and lives of students in danger.

57.title: Indian students kept as hostages by Ukrainian authorities in Kharkiv: Russia
57.article_body: Russia has accused Ukrainian authorities of keeping Indian students in Kharkiv as hostages and said its armed forces were ready to take all necessary measures to safely evacuate them. The accusation was denied by Ukraine which asked countries "whose students have become hostages of the Russian armed aggression" to demand opening a humanitarian corridor to other Ukrainian cities.

58.title: How can a person’s rate be ₹20: Bhansali on watching sex-workers as a kid
58.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said that he would see sex workers on his way to school everyday. "How can a person's rate be ₹20...We can't be sold for ₹5 or ₹20 or ₹50. It is inhuman," he said, adding, "They make themselves up. They put so much paint and powder, look at the grief...How do you camouflage that grief?"

59.title: I wanted to but he has changed now: Bhansali on working with Salman Khan
59.article_body: Sanjay Leela Bhansali said he has left it up to actor Salman Khan to decide if they'd be able to work together again. "Salman is a...dear friend, and I wanted to work with him after 'Padmaavat'...For whatever reasons, it didn't turn out," he said. "We all change as people. So he has changed; in his mind, I've changed," Bhansali added.

60.title: Netflix pauses all projects, acquisitions in Russia: Report
60.article_body: Netflix has temporarily stopped all future projects and acquisitions in Russia amid the ongoing invasion by Russia in Ukraine, Reuters reported citing sources. It had four Russian-language series in production and post-production, including a detective drama "Zato". Earlier, Netflix had refused to add state-run channels to its Russian service, despite a regulation in place over the same.

61.title: 7.1-kg ganja worth over ₹4 lakh seized at railway station in Bengaluru
61.article_body: Bengaluru's Railway Protection Force (RPF) said that they have seized 7.1 kg of ganja worth ₹4,26,000 at Banaswadi Railway Station. The operation was led by Umesh Dhakar, Inspector, RPF, Baiyyappanahalli, it added. Separately, RPF personnel also arrested two people for "indulging in illegal procuring and supplying railway tickets". A total of 64 tickets worth ₹93,895 were seized from them.

62.title: Stayed with cat in bunker: Indians share tales of pets they brought from Ukraine
62.article_body: After Centre relaxed evacuation norms for pets, Indian students brought their pets from war-torn Ukraine. "This cat has been with me for past four months. It stayed with me in bunker and then we crossed into Poland together," said Gautam, who reached Delhi in IAF's C-17 aircraft. "I have brought my friend's dog with me," said Zahid, another returnee.

63.title: 42-yr-old woman found dead at home in Gurugram, husband booked
63.article_body: A 42-year-old woman was found dead at her rented home in Gurugram's Sushant Lok on Wednesday, police said. Her second husband, who is on the run, has been booked for the alleged murder. "The couple often fought with each other. The suspect was an alcoholic and also a drug addict. He recently left work and stayed at home," police added.

64.title: Pimpri-Chinchwad will have to recycle sewage water in 10-15 yrs: Ex-official
64.article_body: Pravin Ladkat, former joint city engineer of Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation said civic body is planning to increase sewage treatment plants and their capacities. He said area's population is 27 lakh currently and will go up to 40 lakh in 10-15 years. "We will have to...recycle and reuse water...We plan to treat sewage water...then release it into the river," Ladkat said.

65.title: Shahid Kapoor's sister Sanah Kapur marries Mayank Pahwa, pics surface
65.article_body: Actress Sanah Kapur, daughter of Pankaj Kapur and Supriya Pathak, tied the knot with actor and assistant director Mayank Pahwa on Wednesday. Actor Shahid Kapoor took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with his sister and wrote, "How time flies and little bitto is now a bride. All grown up all too soon my baby sister."

66.title: EU cuts 7 Russian banks from global payment system SWIFT, bans RT & Sputnik
66.article_body: The European Union has said that it is cutting seven Russian banks, including the country's second-biggest lender VTB Bank, from the main international payment system SWIFT. The list doesn't include Russia's largest lender Sberbank and Gazprombank, which handle payments for Russian oil. The EU also banned Russian state-run media outlets RT and Sputnik over disinformation on Ukraine's invasion.

67.title: Don't blame students: Priyanka on minister's 'students were unwilling to leave Ukraine' claim
67.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi has criticised the blame-game over the evacuation of Indian students in Ukraine after Union Minister V Muraleedharan said students didn't want to leave as universities refused to conduct online classes. "Sir. Please stop. Please for heavens sake don't blame the students when they are mentally traumatised and struggling to get out of Kharkiv," Chaturvedi said.

68.title: Russian billionaire Abramovich to sell Chelsea, donate net proceeds to Ukraine victims
68.article_body: Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich, who bought Chelsea in 2003, has decided to sell the football club. All "net proceeds from the sale" will be donated to all "victims of the war in Ukraine", he said in a press release. Abramovich said he'll not ask the club to repay him the reported £1.5 billion he has loaned them in 19 years.

69.title: Conor McGregor considering buying Chelsea, shares screenshot of WhatsApp chat
69.article_body: Ex-UFC featherweight and lightweight champion Conor McGregor took to Twitter to suggest that he is considering buying Chelsea, which has been put on sale by their Russian owner Roman Abramovich. McGregor posted a screenshot of a WhatsApp chat in which he had sent some messages reading: "Chelsea for sale £3bn. Let's buy it." "I wish to explore this," McGregor tweeted.

70.title: India explains why it abstained from UNGA vote deploring Russia's aggression
70.article_body: Explaining why it abstained from UN General Assembly vote deploring Russia's aggression against Ukraine, India said, "India supports the international community's call for an immediate ceasefire. We also support safe humanitarian access to conflict zones." It added, "India urges that all Member States demonstrate their commitment to the principles of the UN Charter."

71.title: Russian entrepreneur's 'Wanted: dead or alive' post on Putin goes viral; offers $1 mn
71.article_body: A $1 million bounty has been placed on Russian President Vladimir Putin by entrepreneur Alex Konanykhin after the invasion of Ukraine. Alex Konanykhin's 'Wanted: dead or alive' post on Putin, in which he wrote, "Putin is not the Russian President as he...violated the Constitution by eliminating free elections and murdering his opponents," went viral on social media.

72.title: 3-year-old boy dies after coming in contact with live wire in Pune
72.article_body: A three-year-old boy, Shahzad Amir Sayyed, died of electrocution after touching live wire in Pune's Kondhwa area. The wire was protruding from a distribution panel (DP) box near his house. "My son was on his way home...He was playing with stick which fell...he bent down to pick it...got electrocuted. He was stuck to wire...fell down...after he died," boy's father said.

73.title: Voting underway for 6th phase of Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections
73.article_body: The sixth phase of polling for the Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections began at 7 am on Thursday. As many as 676 candidates, including Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, are contesting on 57 seats spread across 10 districts in the sixth phase. The voting for 292 of the 403 Assembly seats has been completed till now in five phases.

74.title: 15-year-old boy drowns in stream in Thane; doctors declare him dead
74.article_body: A 15-year-old boy drowned in a stream in Thane's Diva on Wednesday, police said. He was taken to a hospital, however, doctors declared him dead before admission. An official said that the deceased boy went to the stream with his two friends. "The two other boys knew swimming but [he] was unable to swim...and, hence, he drowned," the official added.

75.title: Disclosure of veg, non-veg ingredients of food items fundamental: Delhi HC
75.article_body: Delhi High Court has said it's "fundamental" to provide a "complete disclosure" about a food item being "vegetarian or non-vegetarian". It said that fundamental rights of people are impacted by what is offered on the platter. The court had earlier ordered food company owners to give a "complete disclosure" of all components used in the production of any food products.

76.title: Man sexually assaults 15-yr-old after offering ride in tempo near Mumbai
76.article_body: A man has been arrested by police for allegedly sexually assaulting a minor girl after offering her a ride in a tempo in Bhayandar near Mumbai. The accused allegedly took the 15-year-old to a shed in Nallasopara forcefully. The accused had also threatened to kill her if she informed anyone about the crime.

77.title: Explosion lights up night sky in various colours as scooter thrown on rail track in UK
77.article_body: A loud explosion was heard and fire lit up the night sky in orange, blue and white colours after a group of youths threw a scooter onto rail tracks causing an electrical fault in UK's Southampton. British Transport Police and firefighters were called to St Denys station and the scooter was recovered. Several people shared the explosion's video on Twitter.

78.title: India abstains as UN General Assembly adopts resolution deploring Russia's aggression
78.article_body: India has abstained on the UN General Assembly resolution that strongly deplored Russia's aggression against Ukraine. The UN General Assembly has adopted the resolution after a total of 141 members voted in the favour of the resolution while 5 members opposed it. India was among 35 nations who abstained from voting.

79.title: We offer sympathies to India: Ukraine's UN envoy after Indian student died in shelling
79.article_body: Ukraine Ambassador to UN Sergiy Kyslytsya condoled the demise of 21-year-old Indian student Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar. He said, "Ukraine deeply regrets that a student from India has become a victim of this shelling by the Russian Armed Forces." "We offer our deepest sympathies to India and the relatives of the victim," Kyslytsya stated.

80.title: Bollywood actors including SRK inspiration for Radhe Shyam: Prabhas
80.article_body: Actor Prabhas during the launch event of his upcoming movie 'Radhe Shyam' said Amitabh Bachchan, Salman Khan and Shah Rukh Khan are his inspirations from Bollywood for his new movie. "Amitabh sir is a legend, everybody loves him," he added. The actor also emphasised on the importance of Indian films and talked about the success of Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa'.

81.title: Over 2,000 Ukrainian civilians killed since invasion began: Ukraine
81.article_body: Ukraine's emergency service on Wednesday said over 2,000 Ukrainian civilians have been killed so far since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began last week. "Children, women and defence forces are losing their lives every hour," the emergency service said in a statement. It added that Russia has destroyed hundreds of structures including homes, kindergartens, hospitals and transport facilities.

82.title: Suriya offers prayers for Indians in Ukraine at his film's trailer launch
82.article_body: Actor Suriya offered a joint prayer along with his fans for the safe return of the Indians stuck in Ukraine at his upcoming film's trailer launch on Wednesday. Speaking after the launch of the trailer of 'Etharkkum Thunindhavan', he said, "Let us all pray together that without any loss of life, everybody must safely come back home."

83.title: It was a dream come true: Actor Manav Kaul on working with Madhuri
83.article_body: Actor Manav Kaul, while sharing about his experience working with veteran actress Madhuri Dixit in Netflix series 'The Fame Game' said it was a dream come true. The 'Kai Po Che' and 'Tumhari Sulu' actor further said he was initially nervous, adding, "When we started shooting...felt like I was working with an actor who was equally invested in the project."

84.title: Fitbit recalls over 10 lakh Ionic smartwatches in US over burn injury risk
84.article_body: Google-owned Fitbit has recalled over 10 lakh of its Ionic smartwatches over reports that overheating batteries caused burn injuries, the US Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) said on Wednesday. Fitbit received at least 115 reports of the incident in the US and 59 from overseas. Some incidents even caused second- and third-degree burns. "These incidents are very rare," Fitbit said.

85.title: Russian F1 driver banned from British Grand Prix
85.article_body: Formula One's Russian driver Nikita Mazepin has been barred from participating in the British Grand Prix following a Motorsport UK decision amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The Haas driver was permitted to continue racing in Formula One 2022 after the FIA opted against banning Russian and Belarusian drivers by allowing them to compete under a neutral flag.

86.title: Photographer saves Alia Bhatt from getting hit by branch, video surfaces
86.article_body: A photographer saved Alia Bhatt from getting hit by a branch of a tree while she was promoting her film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' on an open bus on the movie's release date. The video of the incident shows Alia covering her face with her saree and ducking as the photographer accompanying her is seen lifting the branch up to save her.

87.title: F1 champion Max Verstappen to sign new deal with Red Bull: Reports
87.article_body: Formula One world champion Max Verstappen has reportedly agreed a new long-term deal with Red Bull. The deal is said to be worth around €40-50 million per year, making it one of the most lucrative contract deals in F1. Verstappen's current contract with Red Bull expires in 2023. "I'm very, very happy where I am, that's for sure," Verstappen said.

88.title: Terrorists shoot dead panchayat member at his home in J&K's Kulgam
88.article_body: A panchayat member in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district was shot dead by terrorists on Wednesday, officials said. Mohammad Yaqub Dar was critically injured after he was attacked at his residence. He was taken to a hospital where he succumbed to the injuries, the officials added.

89.title: Mamata shown black flags during visit to Varanasi, video surfaces
89.article_body: Members of the Hindu Yuva Vahini protested against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday during her visit to PM Narendra Modi's Lok Sabha constituency Varanasi. A video shared by BJP's Amit Malviya shows protesters raising slogans and waving black flags at her while police tried to control the crowd. "Mamata Banerjee wapas jao (go back)," said a few protesters.

90.title: Will start metro in 5 districts if BJP retains power in UP: Nadda
90.article_body: BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda on Wednesday promised the BJP-led government will start metro services in Uttar Pradesh's Agra, Gorakhpur, Varanasi, Prayagraj and Meerut in the next five years if BJP retains power. "UP has marked the lowest unemployment rate under the Yogi government. Through MSMEs, over three lakh jobs have been created in the state," Nadda further said.

91.title: No student from the state is stranded in Kyiv anymore: Himachal CM
91.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur on Wednesday said that no student from the state was stranded in Ukraine's capital, Kyiv. "Government is putting efforts for the protection of students in Ukraine and bringing them back as soon as possible," he said. However, some are still stuck in Kharkiv, where an Indian student was killed on Tuesday, he added.

92.title: Japan ready to take in Ukrainians fleeing Russian invasion: PM
92.article_body: Japan is willing to take in Ukrainian refugees who are fleeing Russian invasion, Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said on Wednesday. Kishida has asked Poland's PM Mateusz Morawiecki to help Japanese citizens who are stranded in Ukraine enter Poland swiftly via land routes. Over 8.7 lakh Ukrainians have fled the country since the invasion last week, the UN said.

93.title: Afghan man walks barefoot in snow to protest unfair distribution of aid
93.article_body: A man from Afghanistan's Daikundi province walked several miles barefoot in snow to protest the alleged unfair distribution of humanitarian aid, local media reported. He reportedly said the amount of humanitarian aid in Daikundi province is small compared to other provinces. He alleged that local Taliban officials are distributing aid to their relatives and not reaching out to deserving people.

94.title: PM Modi speaks to Putin, discusses safe evacuation of Indians
94.article_body: PM Narendra Modi spoke on the phone today with Russian President Vladimir Putin, according to an official statement. The leaders reviewed the situation in Ukraine, especially in Kharkiv where many Indian students are stuck. They also discussed the safe evacuation of the Indian nationals from the conflict areas.

95.title: Explosion lights up night sky in various colours as scooter thrown on rail track in UK
95.article_body: A loud explosion was heard and fire lit up the night sky in orange, blue and white colours after a group of youths threw a scooter onto rail tracks causing an electrical fault in UK's Southampton. British Transport Police and firefighters were called to St Denys station and the scooter was recovered. Several people shared the explosion's video on Twitter.

96.title: Going to Varanasi to campaign for SP's Akhilesh Yadav: Mamata
96.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday said that she was going to Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi to campaign for Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav. Banerjee was at the Kolkata airport and said, "I will go to the temple. I am taking the blessings of people and going to UP," she said.

97.title: Everton suspend multiple sponsorship deals with Russian companies
97.article_body: Everton on Wednesday said the club has suspended sponsorship deals with USM Holdings, Megafon and Yota. All three are associated with Alisher Usmanov, a billionaire whose assets were frozen by the EU due to his "particularly close ties to Russian President Vladimir Putin". Everton will reportedly start removing their logos from its stadium Goodison Park and training ground Finch Farm.

98.title: Russia's war is based on lies: German Foreign Minister Baerbock
98.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Tuesday called on UN member states to strongly condemn Russia's invasion of Ukraine, adding, "Russia's war is one of aggression and it is based on lies." Baerbock spoke at an emergency meeting of the UN General Assembly. Baerbock accused Russia of abusing its power as a permanent member of the UN Security Council.

99.title: Eastern Ukraine cities remain areas of concern: Govt on stranded Indians
99.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs while talking about the evacuation process of Indians from Ukraine said the cities in eastern Ukraine remain areas of concern. "Some students were able to board trains out of Kharkiv [Tuesday] night and [Wednesday] morning," MEA Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said. The Indian embassy in Ukraine has asked Indians in Kharkiv to leave the city immediately.

100.title: Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Prithviraj' to release on June 3
100.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actor Akshay Kumar announced that his upcoming film 'Prithviraj' will release on June 3. "Elated to announce that Samrat Prithviraj Chauhan's grand saga is arriving sooner on the big screen," Akshay wrote. The film was slated to release on June 10. 'Prithviraj' also features former Miss World Manushi Chhillar and actor Sanjay Dutt.

101.title: Why weren't the students stuck in Ukraine evacuated earlier: Mamata
101.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday asked why Indian students were not brought back from Ukraine earlier when the Central government became aware of the developments. "Somebody died. Some people are moving from here and there. Somebody is waiting in bunkers, somebody is waiting in Romania, somebody is not getting food," she further said.

102.title: Govt prepared a draft for women's empowerment policy: Maha Minister
102.article_body: Maharashtra Minister for Women and Child Development Yashomati Thakur has said that the state government has prepared a draft for the new women's empowerment policy that takes a holistic view of gender equality. "The policy focuses on the social and economic development of women and persons belonging to the LGBTQIA lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans, queer, intersex, asexual community," Thakur said.

103.title: Israel, Germany call for an increase in Russia-Ukraine peace talks
103.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett on Wednesday called for increased peace talks between Russia and Ukraine. "I'm very thankful that both of us are going to do what we can to make sure that talks between Ukraine and Russia will soon be continued," Scholz said on his first tour to Israel as German chancellor.

104.title: Requirement to wear masks indoors at Pentagon dropped by US military
104.article_body: The US military on Wednesday said it is dropping indoor mask requirements for 20,000 military and civilian employees at the Pentagon, after the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) updated its COVID-19 guidelines. The decision follows the White House telling federal agencies on Monday that they can remove mask mandates for visitors and employees in US federal buildings.

105.title: Russian, Belarusian athletes to compete as neutrals at Paralympics
105.article_body: The International Paralympic Committee (IPC) on Wednesday said Russian and Belarusian athletes can compete as neutrals in the upcoming Winter Paralympics in Beijing. "They will compete under the Paralympic flag and not be included in the medal table," the IPC said. The IPC added they will not host any events in Russia or Belarus until further notice.

106.title: Woman kills 34-yr-old husband over domestic dispute in Rajasthan
106.article_body: A woman allegedly strangled her 34-year-old husband to death in the Barmer district of Rajasthan, police said on Wednesday. According to the police, the couple was addicted to alcohol and had a dispute on Tuesday evening. The Station House Officer (SHO) of Kotwali Police Station, Ugamraj Soni, said that the accused was unhappy with her husband's low income.

107.title: Shibani Dandekar dismisses pregnancy rumours, says 'It was tequila'
107.article_body: Actress Shibani Dandekar put an end to the rumours that suggested she was pregnant. Taking to Instagram Stories, Shibani posted a photo of herself and wrote, "I am nottttt pregnant! It was the tequila." Rumours began after users speculated the reason behind Shibani's bloated stomach in the comment section of her wedding photo with her husband Farhan Akhtar.

108.title: 4 IAF's C-17s to bring back 800 Indians from Ukraine in next 12 hrs
108.article_body: India on Wednesday sent four C-17 military transport aircraft to Romania, Poland and Hungary to evacuate Indian students from Ukraine, officials said. The first IAF aircraft from Romania is likely to land at Hindon airbase at 1.30 am, officials added. Three more aircraft will return by 8 am on Thursday. The four aircraft will bring back about 800 Indian evacuees.

109.title: 8-yr-old practising acrobatics in room accidentally hangs self with ribbons in Argentina
109.article_body: An eight-year-old girl died in Argentina allegedly after accidentally hanging herself while practising acrobatics with fabric ribbons in her bedroom. Her parents reportedly found her hanging from the fabric and tried to revive her. "It is not goodbye, it is see you soon Laylita. We are going to miss you a lot, Princess," her family wrote on social media.

110.title: 25-yr-old woman from Punjab dies after being hit with rod in Canada
110.article_body: A 25-year-old woman from Punjab's Kapurthala died on Wednesday after she was allegedly hit on the head with a rod by a Canadian national last week. The woman, who had gone to Canada on a study visa six years ago, was currently working as a private security guard. A man known to the family confirmed her death.

111.title: Man rapes 45-year-old co-worker in Bhopal factory, arrested
111.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was allegedly raped by her co-worker in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh. The incident took place on February 24 when the victim, who works at a bottle cleaning plant in the city, was alone in the factory. Police have now arrested the accused, who also allegedly threatened the victim with dire consequences if she reported the matter to others.

112.title: SEBI didn't dilute orders on NSE matter, acted as per remit: Ex-SEBI Chief
112.article_body: Former SEBI Chairman Ajay Tyagi on Wednesday said the regulator didn't "dilute" its orders on the National Stock Exchange issue, and that it "came out with orders within [SEBI's] remit and understanding". This comes days after Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government was analysing if SEBI took "necessary punitive" action in the matter. SEBI's working is transparent, Tyagi added.

113.title: Scindia takes injured girl to seat in evacuation flight; video shows her asking for selfie
113.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia taking an Indian girl who was stranded in Ukraine to front row of the evacuation flight and asking fellow passengers to take care of her. She had a ligament tear and reportedly was stuck in Bucharest. The video also shows the girl requesting Scindia for a selfie with her.

114.title: Was asked to step down from projects due to pregnancy: Neha Dhupia
114.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia revealed that she was asked to step down from projects due to her pregnancy. "You're like 'okay, maybe it's not the requirement of the role'...and you just got to wait and you part ways amicably," she added. Referring to Kareena Kapoor Khan shooting for 'Laal Singh Chaddha' during her pregnancy, Neha said, "I really respect her."

115.title: Putin's Russia has already committed war crimes in Ukraine: UK PM
115.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin's regime has already committed war crimes in Ukraine. He said, "What we've seen already from...Putin's regime, in the use of the munitions that they've already been dropping on innocent civilians, in my view already fully qualifies as a war crime." Johnson, however, added, "With...heroism of Ukraine's people...Putin will fail."

116.title: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's 'Ponniyin Selvan-1' to release on Sept 30
116.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's 'Ponniyin Selvan-1' will receive a theatrical release on September 30. The film is directed by Mani Ratnam. It will also feature Vikram, Jayam Ravi and Sobhita Dhulipala. The film is an adaptation of Kalki Krishnamurthy's novel 'Ponniyin Selvan'. The film is jointly produced by Lyca Productions and Madras Talkies.

117.title: India trying to increase its footprint in international gaming sector: PM Modi
117.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the gaming sector "is huge internationally" and India is trying to increase its footprint in it. "The number of youth connected to this market globally is increasing. That's why...we have focused on Animation Visual Effects Gaming Comic [in Budget 2022]," PM Modi said. "For us, technology is mainstay of making the country self-reliant," he added.

118.title: MLC elections in Bihar on April 4, counting of votes on April 7
118.article_body: The Election Commission of India (ECI) on Wednesday announced that biennial elections to 24 Legislative Council (MLC) seats in Bihar will be held on April 4. The candidates will be able to file their nominations till March 16 and the last date to withdraw one's candidature is March 21. Counting of votes will be held on April 7.

119.title: Aamir said show 'Pathaan' first: SRK on whether he watched 'Laal Singh...'
119.article_body: During the #AskSRK session, a Twitter user asked actor Shah Rukh Khan if he had watched actor Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. To this, Shah Rukh replied, "Arre yaar Aamir kehta hai pehle Pathaan dikha (Aamir said show 'Pathaan' first)!" 'Pathaan' also features John Abraham and Deepika Padukone. The film will release on January 25, 2023.

120.title: Hunger will kill people for sure if Russia doesn't: Ukrainian man
120.article_body: A resident of Ukraine's Kherson city, which is claimed to have been taken by Russian troops, said he's terrified and "has no hope". The man said, "I don't know if...Russians will kill us or not, but hunger will kill people here for sure." "I just hope...Russian President Vladimir Putin will think of civilians as humans for one time," he added.

121.title: Pic shows captured Russian soldier crying while saying 'I love you' to mother on phone
121.article_body: Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) has shared a picture of a captured Russian soldier who can be seen crying while talking on phone. SBU also shared the soldier's video, wherein he could be seen breaking down in tears while telling his mother "I love you too" over the phone. "They sent us to death, everyone killed everyone," he reportedly said.

122.title: Which major US & European companies have taken action against Russia?
122.article_body: British oil companies BP and Shell announced their exit from Russia following its invasion of Ukraine. Europe's Airbus and America's ExxonMobil and Boeing, have cut ties with Russia, while Harley-Davidson and General Motors suspended vehicle exports to Russia. Apple and Dell halted all product sales in Russia, and Apple said, "We are deeply concerned about the Russian invasion of Ukraine."

123.title: 21-yr-old Indian & girlfriend escape from Ukraine, say 'For 2 days we were on road'
123.article_body: Indians Harsh Panwar, 21, and his girlfriend Reva Shrivastava, 19, who met while studying medicine at a university in Ukraine, recently escaped the country. "It was...like crossing...border from cruelty to hospitality...For two days we were on the road without any shelter," said Shrivastava. From the Romanian border, they joined a group of students driven to villages near Bucharest's main airport.

124.title: Pujara, Rahane, Pandya get demoted in BCCI central contracts list
124.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara, Ajinkya Rahane and Hardik Pandya have been downgraded in latest central contracts list of BCCI that was ratified by the board's apex council on Wednesday. Pujara and Rahane, who were in Grade A (₹5 crore) are now in Grade B (₹3 crore). Pandya, who was in Grade A (₹5 crore), has been demoted to Grade C (₹1 crore).

125.title: No one will forgive Russia for killing peaceful people: Ukraine Prez
125.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has released a social media video, wherein he slammed Russia for killing "peaceful Ukrainian people". Zelensky said, "Russian forces brutally fired on Kharkiv from jet artillery. It was clearly a war crime. There will be an international tribunal." "No one in the world will forgive you [Russia] for killing peaceful Ukrainian people," he added.

126.title: Not true: NCB on reports claiming no evidence against Aryan in drugs case
126.article_body: Sanjay Singh, the Deputy Director General of the NCB, has refuted media reports that claimed there was no evidence against Aryan Khan in the Mumbai cruise drugs case. "These are not true...just speculations," Sanjay stated. He added, "Investigation is not yet complete...it's premature to say anything at this stage." Sanjay is chief of the Special Investigation Team on the case.

127.title: PM Modi chairs 5th high-level meeting on Russia-Ukraine war
127.article_body: PM Narendra Modi chaired the fifth high-level meeting on the Russia-Ukraine war at 8:30 pm on Wednesday, soon after the Indian Embassy in Ukraine asked nationals to leave Kharkiv immediately. Earlier, PM said, "We're working round the clock to bring back all Indian nationals who are stranded in the warzone." He said the government understands the hardships students are facing.

128.title: 2 Ukrainian footballers aged 21 and 25 killed amid war with Russia
128.article_body: FIFPRO, the global footballers' union, announced that two Ukrainian footballers, 21-year-old Vitalii Sapylo and 25-year-old Dmytro Martynenko, have been killed in Kyiv amid Ukraine-Russia war. Sapylo is said to have died in Kyiv last Friday after joining the army as a tank commander, while Martynenko was reportedly killed after Russian bombs hit his home in an apartment block.

129.title: Maha reports no COVID-related death for 1st time since April 2020
129.article_body: For the first time since April 1, 2020, Maharashtra reported no coronavirus-related death on Wednesday. As per the bulletin, 544 new COVID-19 cases were reported in Maharashtra today while 1,007 patients were discharged. Further, 38 cases of the new coronavirus variant Omicron were also reported. Notably, Maharashtra's capital Mumbai logged no COVID-related death for the sixth straight day.

130.title: Malta suspends sale of its passports to Russians & Belarusians
130.article_body: Malta on Wednesday stopped sale of its passports to Russians and Belarusians, citing lack of necessary checks on prospective citizenship buyers from these two countries amid Russia-Ukraine war. Malta has been selling its passports since 2014 as part of a 'citizenship by investment' scheme. It allows foreigners to acquire Maltese citizenship by investing a minimum of €600,000 in the country.

131.title: Scindia speaks in Marathi with Indian student in Romania, video surfaces
131.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia interacted with Indian students waiting for their flights in Romania's Bucharest. In a video retweeted by him on Twitter, Scindia can be heard speaking Marathi with a student. He asked the student his name and where he was from. When he replied that he was from Maharashtra, Scindia asked him to speak in Marathi.

132.title: Indian students were kicked, dragged by Ukrainian officials: UP student after returning
132.article_body: Uttar Pradesh-based student Anshika, who returned from Ukraine on Tuesday, said Indian students were kicked and dragged by Ukrainian officials near Romanian border. "Someone pushed the students [while crossing the border], injuring a girl. Romanian army even fired in air. After this, the Ukraine officials kicked the Indian students who had fallen down and they were also dragged," she added.

133.title: New sanctions against Belarus over Ukraine invasion approved by EU
133.article_body: The French Presidency of the EU on Wednesday said the EU has approved new sanctions against Belarus for its role in supporting Russia's invasion of Ukraine. EU officials said one of the aims of the new sanctions was to stop exports of Belarusian goods to the EU. The sanctions are aimed at economic sectors like steel, timber and potash.

134.title: Who is India-born Abhay Kumar Singh, Putin's legislator who justified Russia's invasion?
134.article_body: Abhay Kumar Singh is a deputat, a post similar to an MLA in India, from Kursk, a Western Russian city. He started his business in Kursk and later joined politics. Hailing from Patna in Bihar, Singh reportedly went to Russia in 1991 to study medicine. He joined Putin's United Russia Party in 2015 and won a provincial election in 2018.

135.title: I won't wish this to even an enemy: 20-yr-old Indian who returned from Ukraine
135.article_body: Yash Pal, a 20-year-old medical student from Thane who studies in Ukraine, on his return to India, said, "I went through hell in those five days. I heard blasts, firing and saw people bleeding and running." He added, "I won't wish anything like this to even an enemy." Yash made a 600 km journey from Kyiv to the Romanian border.

136.title: Putin 'knows no limit' to how much violence Russia will use in Ukraine: UK
136.article_body: UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace on Wednesday said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "seems to know no limit to how much violence they will use in Ukraine". Wallace warned that Russia will "carpet-bomb, slowly surround and bombard" the cities of Ukraine in an act of "brutality". Notably, the Russian invasion of Ukraine entered its seventh day on Wednesday.

137.title: Sweden to send medical supplies to Ukraine amid Russian invasion
137.article_body: Sweden will send a "large amount" of medical supplies to Ukraine amid the Russian invasion, Swedish Health Minister Lena Hallengren said on Wednesday. The transfer of aid comes upon request from EU and will include one million face masks, bandages and disinfectants, along with other advanced equipment such as ventilators. Sweden closed its airspace to Russian planes on Monday.

138.title: Video shows farmers capturing & burning ₹114-crore Russian missile system in Ukraine
138.article_body: A video showing farmers burning a ₹114-crore Russian missile system in a Ukrainian field has surfaced online. Ukrainian mayor Borys Filatov claimed that farmers seized and destroyed the vehicle, adding that Russian soldiers were forced to run across the "Ukrainian fields like rats". "War is terrible grief, but these people (farmers) cannot be defeated," Filatov said.

139.title: Will free captive Russian soldiers whose mothers come to collect them: Ukraine
139.article_body: Ukraine on Wednesday announced that it would free any Russian prisoners whose mothers come to collect them in Ukraine's Kiev. "You need to call the phone number indicated in the flyer to find out if your son is captive or dead," Ukraine's Ministry of Defence said. The Ministry also shared a detailed path for the mothers to reach Kiev.

140.title: Akhilesh doesn't have strength to stop BJP from winning in UP: Owaisi
140.article_body: AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi said on Tuesday that Samajwadi Party (SP) supremo Akhilesh Yadav doesn't have "strength" to stop BJP from coming to power in UP. Owaisi added that despite SP's alliances with Congress and Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) in 2017 and 2019, it couldn't stop BJP from forming government. "Only Bhagidari Sankalp Morcha...can help UP get rid of...BJP,” he added.

141.title: Beyond silly: Manish Tewari on ministers greeting Ukraine returnees
141.article_body: Former Union Minister and Congress leader Manish Tewari on Wednesday criticised Union Ministers who have been greeting students rescued from war-hit Ukraine. "Young Indian students who barely escaped with the skin of their teeth...are being subjected to sanctimonious homilies by these ministers...in order to do their own political public relations and propaganda is beyond silly," he said.

142.title: Theatres, restaurants to function at 100% capacity in Mumbai & 13 other Maha districts
142.article_body: Amid declining COVID-19 cases, the Maharashtra government eased restrictions and allowed theatres, restaurants, bars, shopping complexes, gyms, swimming pools, tourist places and entertainment parks to function at 100% capacity in 14 districts including Mumbai and Pune. These 14 districts are the ones where over 90% have received first dose of COVID-19 vaccine and over 70% have got both doses.

143.title: Nearly 17,000 Indians have left Ukraine borders so far: Govt
143.article_body: Nearly 17,000 Indians have left Ukraine borders since India issued advisories in the last week of January, Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said on Wednesday. He informed that so far, six evacuation flights from Ukraine have landed in India and 15 flights are scheduled in the next 24 hours. A flight from Bucharest will land in Delhi tonight.

144.title: Pic shows young girl crying as she leaves behind her father fighting for Ukraine
144.article_body: An image shows a young girl crying at the border with Poland after leaving behind her father who's fighting in Ukraine amid Russia's invasion. She has a yellow rucksack with a few belongings as her family escaped the bombings and headed for the border with Poland. Male citizens of Ukraine aged 18 to 60 are prohibited from leaving the country.

145.title: Always knew 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' is an Alia Bhatt film: Shantanu
145.article_body: Actor Shantanu Maheshwari said that he knew that 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' is an Alia Bhatt film from the beginning. "However, I also knew that I have an important part in the film...I had complete belief in myself," he added. Shantanu further said that Alia doesn't carry an aura of a star and added, "She is very cooperative and a team player."

146.title: Actress Joey King gets engaged to boyfriend Steven Piet, shares pics
146.article_body: Actress Joey King announced her engagement to boyfriend and director Steven Piet. Joey took to Instagram and shared the pictures from the proposal. "Date was 2/2/22 when you asked me to marry you and made me the luckiest lady alive," she captioned the post. "Hanging out with you forever sounds like a real dream, so let's do it," she added.

147.title: Ukrainian policeman's family 'killed by Russian troops' while he was on patrol
147.article_body: A Ukrainian policeman's entire family, including his six-year-old daughter and six-week-old son, was reportedly shot dead by Russian soldiers. The policeman was out on patrol when his family was attacked. His brother, who was reportedly talking to their mother at the time of the incident, said, "I kept hearing my mother yelling that there were children...And then I heard shots."

148.title: Director Reeves misses 'The Batman' premiere after contracting COVID
148.article_body: Director Matt Reeves missed the premiere of his film 'The Batman' after contracting COVID-19. "It's a great heartbreak for me because this movie means so much to me," Reeves said through a video message at the premiere. Reeves informed that he contracted the virus despite receiving double vaccination and a booster shot. "The good news is...I'm healthy," he added.

149.title: Allegations that we were late to start evacuation in Ukraine not right: Union Minister
149.article_body: Union Minister V Muraleedharan on Wednesday said the allegations that the government was late to initiate evacuation of Indian students are not right. "Students didn't want to leave as [Ukrainian] universities were not ready to conduct online classes. We released our first advisory before February 24 for students to leave Ukraine," he stated.

150.title: 60 Madhya Pradesh natives have returned from Ukraine: Minister
150.article_body: As many as 60 Madhya Pradesh natives, out of the 193 who sought assistance from the state government for evacuation from Ukraine, have returned to the state so far, Minister Narottam Mishra said on Wednesday. Madhya Pradesh government has directed Superintendents of Police (SP) of all districts to contact the family members of those stranded in Ukraine, he added.

151.title: Kiren Rijiju reaches Slovakia's Kosice to aid evacuation efforts
151.article_body: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju reached the Slovak city of Kosice near the Ukrainian border to coordinate evacuation of Indians stranded in Ukraine under the government's Operation Ganga, his office said on Wednesday. Union Ministers Hardeep Singh Puri, Jyotiraditya Scindia and General VK Singh (Retd) have also been sent to Ukraine's neighbouring countries to aid evacuation.

152.title: Providing generic medicines to poor is govt's top priority: Minister
152.article_body: Union Minister of State for Chemicals and Fertilisers Bhagwanth Khuba on Wednesday said that the government's top priority is to provide generic medicines to the poor at low cost. "On the occasion of Jan Aushadhi Diwas, we are spreading and highlighting more and more Jan Aushadhi medicines," he said. "Doctors should know more about it," he added.

153.title: UP RERA's NCR forum settled 1,150 property disputes worth over ₹345 cr
153.article_body: UP Real Estate Regulatory Authority's (RERA) NCR conciliation forum has so far settled 1,150 disputes involving properties worth over ₹345 crore, officials said. Most of the disputes came from the allottees of the projects in Gautam Buddha Nagar, Ghaziabad, Meerut and Bulandshahr, they added. The cases pertained to delay in registered sale deed and possession of units to allottees.

154.title: Proceed on foot if you can't find vehicles: India while asking citizens to leave Kharkiv
154.article_body: A second advisory issued by Indian Embassy in Ukraine for Indian nationals in Kharkiv further highlighted the urgency to leave Kharkiv "immediately" in light of the "deteriorating situation". "Those students who cannot find vehicles or buses and are in railway station can proceed on foot," it said. The advisory asked Indian nationals to proceed to Pisochin, Babai and Bezlyudivka.

155.title: Will leave no stone unturned for return of Indians from Ukraine: PM
155.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said India is making every effort to evacuate Indian citizens stranded in Ukraine amid the Russia-Ukraine war. He added that four Union Ministers have been sent to Ukraine's neighbouring countries to aid Operation Ganga. The first flight carrying 219 Indians evacuated from Ukraine landed in Mumbai on February 26, two days after Russia invaded Ukraine.

156.title: Pune Metro services likely to become operational from March 6
156.article_body: The CMRS has reportedly given Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation (MahaMetro) a safety clearance certificate to run Pune Metro from March 6. According to MahaMetro, which is executing the Pune Metro rail project, work on the priority stretch has reportedly been completed. This will open 12-km routes from Vanaz to Garware College and PCMC to Phugewadi lines and 10 metro stations.

157.title: 6 flights with evacuated Indians landed in last 24 hours: MEA
157.article_body: MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Wednesday said six flights carrying Indians evacuated from Ukraine have landed in India in the last 24 hours. A total of 3,352 stranded Indians have so far been rescued and brought back to India in 15 flights, Bagchi said. "As many as 15 flights are scheduled over the next 24 hours. Some...are already...enroute," he added.

158.title: Pope thanks Poland for hosting Ukrainian refugees amid Russian war
158.article_body: Pope Francis on Wednesday expressed gratitude to Poland for proactively taking in Ukrainian refugees and asked people across the world to remember Ukrainians seeking refuge in underground bunkers. "You (Poland) were the first to support Ukraine [by] opening your borders [and]...doors of your homes," he said. Over 4.5 lakh Ukrainians have fled to Poland since the Russian invasion, UN said.

159.title: BJP govt worked for overall well-being of women in UP: PM Modi
159.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said that BJP worked for the overall well-being of women in Uttar Pradesh. While addressing a rally in UP's Ghazipur, the PM stressed the issue of 'chulha' smoke, adding that 2.5 lakh women in the district got Ujjwala gas connections, ensuring smoke-free kitchens. BJP has reduced women's sufferings in the last five years, he added.

160.title: Delhi Police ASI arrested for drug trafficking, marijuana worth ₹2cr seized
160.article_body: A Delhi Police Assistant Sub Inspector and his five associates were arrested for alleged drug trafficking and around 1,370 kg of marijuana worth over ₹2 crore was seized. The drugs was packed in 44 sacks and hidden under coconuts in a truck that came to Haryana from Odisha, police said. The ASI is with Delhi Police's special cell.

161.title: I'm praying Ukrainians succeed in what they're trying to do: Ruffalo
161.article_body: Amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict, actor Mark Ruffalo called Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy a hero. "The Ukrainian people are incredible. They're heroes. Zelenskyy is a hero," Ruffalo stated. "That's what it looks like when people come together to fight for something that's right. I'm praying they succeed in what they're trying to do," he further added.

162.title: Ukrainian ambassador gets standing ovation from UK Parliament; video viral
162.article_body: The Ukrainian ambassador to the UK received a standing ovation from the UK Parliamentarians and the UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson himself on Wednesday. Ukrainian ambassador Vadym Prystaiko was in the public gallery as the UK Parliament gave him a standing ovation. The MPs stood up in applause to show solidarity with the Ukrainian people amid the Russian invasion.

163.title: Urban Company to award stocks worth ₹150 cr to service providers over 5-7 yrs
163.article_body: Urban Company on Wednesday announced a ₹150 crore Partner Stock Ownership Plan (PSOP) for its service providers. Under this plan, Urban Company will award stocks to thousands of service partners over the next 5-7 years. The company has already got board approval for the first tranche of ₹75 crore worth of stocks to be disbursed over the next 3-4 years.

164.title: Tamil Nadu lifts COVID-19 curbs, allows 500 people at weddings
164.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government on Wednesday further eased COVID-19 restrictions and allowed 500 persons to attend weddings and related events. A maximum of 250 people can attend funerals, Chief Minister MK Stalin-led government said. The government added that there are no restrictions on social, cultural and political gatherings. The relaxations will come into effect from Thursday.

165.title: Pic of Belarus President with a map of Russia's 'invasion plan' goes viral
165.article_body: An image of Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko pointing towards a map is going viral with reports claiming it displays the invasion plan in Ukraine. It allegedly shows Ukraine divided into four sections and lines of attack already carried out by Russia. According to New York Post, Lukashenko appeared to be talking about a planned attack from southern Ukraine into Moldova.

166.title: Ujjain creates Guinness World Record by lighting 11.71 lakh diyas
166.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain set a Guinness World Record of "largest display of oil lamps" by lighting 11.71 lakh earthen lamps as part of the Mahashivratri celebrations on March 1. MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, "By...grace of Lord Mahakal...it's a privilege to create a unique record." Last year, Ayodhya had set the record by lighting over nine lakh diyas.

167.title: Don't foresee obstacles: Russia on S-400's delivery to India
167.article_body: Russia's Ambassador-designate to India Denis Alipov said he doesn't foresee any obstacles as far as delivery of five regiments of S-400 missile systems to India is concerned amid the sanctions levied on Russia after it invaded Ukraine. "Sanctions, old or new, don't interfere in any way," he said. He thanked India for 'balanced position' at the UN on the invasion.

168.title: UK to send additional £80 million in aid to Ukraine
168.article_body: The UK government on Tuesday said it has pledged another £80 million ($106.5 million) in aid to Ukraine. The government added this brings the UK's total aid to Ukraine up to £220 million. "Britain is at the forefront of efforts to supply life-saving humanitarian aid, as well as political, economic and defensive support," Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said.

169.title: If Samantha was an athlete, she would have been like Kohli: Trainer
169.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu's personal trainer Junaid Shaikh said he "always" tells Samantha, "If you were an athlete, you would have been like Virat Kohli." "Samantha...has an attitude wherein she will just say...'I will try and do it again'. She is very aggressive and wants to do things to the core," added Junaid. "I take motivation from her," he stated.

170.title: 61-yr-old man, wife get life imprisonment for killing relative in TN
170.article_body: A 61-year-old man and his 59-year-old wife were sentenced to life imprisonment for killing a relative in Tamil Nadu's Karur. In 2018, the couple engaged in a scuffle with their relative as he wanted to erect a fence around their home. The couple attacked him with a wooden log, following which he was taken to a hospital where he died.

171.title: Grateful to PM Modi for allowing Indians to return with pets from war-hit Ukraine: PETA
171.article_body: PETA India said it's grateful to PM Narendra Modi and Union Ministers Parshottam Rupala and Sanjeev Balyan "for including companion animals in the evacuation operation of Indians who are stuck in war-hit Ukraine" following its appeal. "Separating animal companions from their guardians would have resulted in more tragedy," PETA added. Earlier, a student refused to leave Ukraine without his pet.

172.title: Williamson is a very fun guy and listens to everyone: Abhishek Sharma
172.article_body: Terming SRH captain Kane Williamson as a "very fun guy" who listens to everyone, SRH all-rounder Abhishek Sharma said he has a "great understanding" with Williamson. "The quality that I like the most about Williamson is his composure and calmness in pressure situations," added Abhishek. Abhishek was bought by SRH for ₹6.5 crore in the mega auction.

173.title: Technology is a medium to empower the people of India: PM Modi
173.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said that technology is a medium to empower the people of the country, adding that it is the mainstay of making India self-reliant.
