"It seems...Governor is the puppet of BJP," TMC MP Santanu Sen said.

347.title: I lost my on-screen virginity after kissing Kirti in 'Human': Shefali
347.article_body: Talking about her kiss with Kirti Kulhari in show 'Human', Shefali Shah said she lost her "on-screen virginity" as she had never kissed on-screen before. "I don't see it as being difficult because it's a woman. It was a true emotion," added Shefali. "I am terrified when I go on sets. I have a lot of self doubt," stated Shefali.

348.title: You've shown exemplary courage: Smriti Irani to Indian evacuees from Ukraine
348.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Wednesday welcomed the Indian students evacuated from Ukraine, in Delhi. "Welcome back home, your families are waiting with bated breath. You've shown exemplary courage," Irani said while interacting with the students as the flight landed at the Delhi airport. "Let's thank the flight crew as well," Irani added.

349.title: Govt was late in ordering evacuation of Indians from Ukraine: Chidambaram
349.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Tuesday said that the Centre was late in ordering the evacuation of Indians stranded in Ukraine. "The government was late in ordering evacuation. The government was also guilty of encouraging Indians to believe that nothing untoward was likely to happen in Ukraine," Chidambaram tweeted yesterday.

350.title: No migratory bird census at Harike wetland for first time in 11 years
350.article_body: For the first time in 11 years, the annual census of migratory birds descending upon Punjab's Harike wetland was not conducted due to COVID-19 pandemic. Migratory birds arrive at Harike wetland in the first week of November and stay till March. "As per the latest survey, around 80 species of migratory birds visited the wetland this year," an official said.

351.title: Ukraine's ambassador to US gets standing ovation at Biden's State of the Union
351.article_body: Ukrainian envoy Oksana Markarova received a standing ovation during President Joe Biden's first State of the Union address. "The Ukrainian Ambassador to the US is here...Let's...stand and send an unmistakable signal to the world, to Ukraine," Biden said. "She's bright, she's strong, she's resolved," he said about Markarova, who held a Ukrainian flag and placed her hand over her heart.

352.title: Was told blood went to heart during CPR due to work out: Bob Odenkirk
352.article_body: While talking about heart attack that he suffered last year in July, American actor Bob Odenkirk said that he was told that more blood was able to go to his heart during CPR because his veins were bigger due to his working out. "Because I was in good shape...you...enlarge veins around your heart...if you work out a lot," he said.

353.title: I had never stepped inside a gym before playing Black Widow: Scarlett
353.article_body: Actress Scarlett Johansson said she had "never" stepped inside a gym before being asked to portray the character of Natasha Romanoff/Black Widow in 2010 movie 'Iron Man 2'. "I had five weeks to prepare myself for these huge stunt sequences," added Scarlett. 'Iron Man 2' also starred Robert Downey Jr and Samuel L. Jackson.

354.title: More heat waves likely in northwest India during summer: IMD
354.article_body: The probability of heat waves over west-central and northwest India will be higher during summer, IMD Director General, Mrutyunjay Mohapatra, said. Normal or below normal heat conditions and lesser heat waves are likely during the upcoming summer season over large geographical areas covering the southern peninsula, central India, the northern plains, east and northeast India, IMD said.

355.title: I'd think to myself 'I'm going to die': Reynolds on battling anxiety
355.article_body: Actor Ryan Reynolds, who plays the lead role in the 'Deadpool' franchise, said, "I have had anxiety my whole life. I would be standing backstage...and I would think to myself 'I'm going to die'. Something horrible's going to happen." "The home that I grew in, that wasn't modelled for me really," added Reynolds who also starred in 'X-Men Origins: Wolverine'.

356.title: PWD to redevelop footpath near IP Flyover to make it pedestrian-friendly
356.article_body: In order to ensure pedestrian safety, the Public Works Department (PWD) is planning to redevelop the footpath from Indraprastha (IP) flyover to ITPO integrated tunnel works. "Currently, the footpath is not in...good condition. It is broken, uneven and two-wheelers often use it to escape traffic jams," an official said. The redevelopment project is estimated to cost ₹79.39 lakh.

357.title: US oil giant Exxon to exit its last Russian project, won't make new investments
357.article_body: American oil giant ExxonMobil will exit its last remaining oil and gas project in Russia and won't invest in new developments in Russia, following Ukraine's invasion. Exxon operates the Sakhalin-1 project on behalf of a consortium that includes Japanese, Indian and Russian companies. Exxon would end over a quarter-century of continuing business presence in Russia by quitting this project.

358.title: Won’t impose sanctions on Russia, want good relations with all: Mexico
358.article_body: The Mexican government said it will not impose any sanctions against Russia over its conflict with Ukraine as it wants to have good relations with all governments. "We want to be in a position to be able to speak with all parties to the conflict," said President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador. He further accused Twitter of censoring messages supporting Russia.

359.title: Novak Djokovic splits with coach Marian Vajda after 15 years
359.article_body: Novak Djokovic has parted ways with his coach Marian Vajda, who has been with the ex-world number one for the last 15 years and saw him win 20 Grand Slam titles. "Marian has been by my side during the most important and memorable moments in my career...While he might be leaving the professional team he'll always be family," said Djokovic.

360.title: Gangster who had been hiding in Thailand held on landing at Delhi airport
360.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday arrested a wanted gangster Virender Partap alias Kala Rana, who had been hiding in Thailand, after he landed at Delhi airport. He was running a syndicate in India from Thailand, police said. "Rana was carrying a reward of ₹1,00,000 for his arrest in connection with a case registered in Haryana," police added.

361.title: Mizoram sets up genome sequencing facility in govt hospital
361.article_body: A genome sequencing facility has been set up at the state-run Virus Research and Diagnostic Laboratory (VRDL) of Zoram Medical College in Mizoram. The laboratory is funded by a US-based organisation called Program for Appropriate Technology in Health (PATH), Health Minister Dr R Lalthangliana informed. Earlier the state's COVID-19 samples were sent to West Bengal's Kalyani for genome sequencing.

362.title: Russia kills our kids, now kill their App Store access: Ukraine Vice PM to Apple CEO
362.article_body: After Apple announced that it paused all its product sales in Russia, Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov wrote on Twitter, "(CEO) Tim Cook, let's finish the job and block App Store access in Russia." "They kill our children, now kill their access!" he said. Last week, Fedorov had written to Cook, asking Apple to cut services supply in Russia.

363.title: Despite 97%, he couldn't get a medical seat in India: Father of Indian killed in Ukraine
363.article_body: After 21-year-old Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar was killed in Ukraine's Kharkiv amid war with Russia, his father Shekharappa said despite scoring 97% in Class 12, his son couldn't get a medical seat in India. "It became inevitable for us to send him to Ukraine...but we lost him," he added. Naveen was a fourth-year MBBS student at Kharkiv National Medical University.

364.title: Many B'wood actors were 'allergic' to act in south remakes: Tusshar
364.article_body: Actor Tusshar Kapoor said earlier many actors in Bollywood had this "allergy" that they'll not do a South remake and will not work with a South director either. He added, "But now, most of these actors are open to doing remake films." Tusshar said he liked his father Jeetendra's remake films. "I'm not biased...I liked them all," he added.

365.title: Pakistani, Turkish students using Indian Flag to escape Ukraine: Indian students
365.article_body: Indian students who arrived in Romania from Ukraine said, "Pakistani and Turkish students are using Indian Flag to escape Ukraine amid the war." "Both Indian Flag and Indians were of great help to the Pakistani and Turkish students," they added. Earlier today, around 220 Indian students arrived in Delhi on a special flight via Istanbul.

366.title: I cut curtain, used spray colours to make Indian Flag: Indian student on escaping Ukraine
366.article_body: An Indian student who reached Bucharest in Romania after escaping Ukraine said, "I cut a curtain and used spray colours to make Indian Flag to paste on the bus." "We were easily given clearance due to Indian Flag," another student said. "Print out Indian Flag and paste prominently on vehicles and buses while travelling," Indian Embassy in Kyiv had said.

367.title: Never imagined I'll be alive: Indian student who left Ukraine's Kharkiv
367.article_body: An Indian student, Rupam Mondal, who managed to leave Ukraine's Kharkiv with friends by train said that there was continuous hurling of bombs and that they could not get out of bunker. "We were preparing food in hostel building when suddenly bombing started. It felt like earthquake. I never imagined I will be alive, it was really scary," Mondal said.

368.title: Husband demands fresh probe over wife's death in Maharashtra jail
368.article_body: Seeking a fresh probe over the death of Kanchan Nanavare in Maharashtra's Yerwada women's prison last year, her husband moved Bombay HC alleging negligence by jail authorities and lack of proper medical care. Kanchan was booked by the Maharashtra ATS in connection with a Maoist case in September 2014 and she died in jail on January 24, 2021.

369.title: Russia plans to introduce Belarusian troops into the war: Ukraine
369.article_body: Russia is preparing a "provocation" to justify the entry of Belarusian troops into the war, the Ukrainian Defence Ministry's Intelligence Unit said. "There are now about 300 Belarusian tanks near the Belarusian-Ukrainian border," it added. Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko on Tuesday said he's deploying more forces to the Ukraine border but denied having plans to join Russia's invasion.

370.title: Will PM Modi have the guts to tell Putin to back off: BJP's Swamy
370.article_body: Talking about the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict, Rajya Sabha MP Subramanian Swamy asked PM Narendra Modi to direct Russia to stop its military offensive. Taking to Twitter, Swamy said, "Now that it is clear that what Russia has done in Ukraine violates BRICS Resolution in Delhi Declaration of last year. Will Modi have the guts to tell Putin to back off?"

371.title: Ukraine-Russia talks unlikely on Wed, Russian demands unrealistic: Turkey
371.article_body: Turkey on Tuesday said Ukrainian and Russian delegations were unlikely to meet for planned talks on Wednesday, adding Moscow's demands to end the invasion were "unrealistic". The talks will "most likely be postponed a couple of days, we're in touch with the negotiating teams", Turkish Presidential Spokesman Ibrahim Kalin said. The first round of negotiations had taken place on Monday.

372.title: When someone says, 'Your time is done', it's hard: Karthik on Wriddhiman
372.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has said Wriddhiman Saha has been a quiet servant of Indian cricket but now he needs to understand "where the selectors, the coach are coming from" in suggesting him to consider retirement. Karthik also added, "When somebody comes in and says, 'I think your time is done,' it can be a hard one to swallow."

373.title: Ankita Lokhande, Vicky Jain buy Mercedes worth ₹1.10 crore, pics surface
373.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande and her husband, businessman Vicky Jain, recently bought a Mercedes-Benz V220d. Taking to Instagram, photographer Viral Bhayani shared a video of the luxury car that arrived at Ankita and Vicky's house. In the video, Ankita along with her husband can be seen removing the cover from the car and is also seen cutting the cake to celebrate.

374.title: Russia’s demands must be addressed, sanctions illegal: China
374.article_body: China on Tuesday said that Russia's "legitimate security demands" owing to NATO's eastward expansion must be taken seriously and properly addressed. It also opposed the sanctions imposed on Moscow by various countries over its ongoing conflict with Ukraine. "We oppose all illegal unilateral sanctions. China and Russia will continue to carry out normal trade cooperation," said Chinese government.

375.title: Don't want to be most beautiful woman, but I'm not hot how I look: Shefali
375.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah said she has lot of self-doubts. "It's not like that I want to be most beautiful woman in the world but I am not hot the way I look," she said, adding, "I'm terrified when I go on sets...I have this...fear director is gonna say action and I'm...gonna stand there dumbfounded not knowing what to do."

376.title: WhatsApp banned 18.58 lakh Indian accounts in January: Report
376.article_body: WhatsApp banned 18.58 lakh Indian accounts in January based on complaints received from users and its own mechanism, according to its report. Meta-owned WhatsApp received grievances against 495 Indian accounts which appealed to ban 285 accounts, out of which 24 were banned. The majority of the accounts were banned for harmful behaviour detected through tools and resources deployed by WhatsApp.

377.title: Mumbai fire dept plans to get 6 fire engines equipped for congested areas
377.article_body: The Mumbai Fire Brigade Department is planning to get six new water tower vehicles that can reach a height of up to 18 metres. These vehicles will be beneficial in tackling fire incidences in densely populated areas and old chawls. Following the approval of the plan, the vehicles are expected to be delivered within 2-4 months.

378.title: 23-yr-old killed over affair with married woman by her brothers in Noida
378.article_body: A 23-year-old man was allegedly killed over suspicion of having an affair with a married woman by her brothers in Greater Noida, police said. "The brothers revealed...they saw the man at their home with their sister...brawl broke out...brothers said they strangled him to death," police added. Preliminary investigation showed the victim's body was thrown into the Ganga canal, police added.

379.title: Russian airborne troops land in Ukraine's Kharkiv, attack hospital
379.article_body: The Ukrainian army has said that Russian airborne troops have landed in the eastern city of Kharkiv. "Russian troops attacked a local hospital. There is an ongoing fight," the army added. At least 10 people were killed and 35 others were injured when Russian forces bombarded the central square in Kharkiv on Tuesday.

380.title: Indian man turns his basement restaurant in Kyiv into shelter home, provides free meals
380.article_body: Manish Dave, a 52-year-old man from Gujarat, has turned his basement restaurant named 'Saathiya' in Kyiv into a shelter home. Since the war broke out on Thursday, Dave has housed and fed more than 130 people at his restaurant. "I will continue to offer shelter and food [for free] for as long as I can," Dave told The Washington Post.

381.title: Two govt officials deployed to help Ukraine evacuees: Karnataka CM
381.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said efforts are on to bring back Kannadigas from Ukraine. "Two (government) officials have been deployed at Mumbai and New Delhi to help the state's people arriving from Ukraine reach their homes without any hassle," Bommai added. "The students in the north-eastern part of Ukraine are facing problems," Bommai told reporters.

382.title: Delhi govt invites expression of interest for 'Dilli Bazaar' portal
382.article_body: The Delhi government has invited expression of interest from agencies to design, develop, operate and maintain the 'Dilli Bazaar' e-commerce platform, including the online portal and offline services. The platform will help local businesses by providing them access to a global online community, Dialogue and Development Commission of Delhi Vice-Chairperson Jasmine Shah said.

383.title: I'm not iconic, Ukraine is iconic: Zelenskyy on becoming a wartime leader
383.article_body: During a CNN interview, Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy was asked about his journey from a comic actor to a global wartime leader, to which he responded, "It's very serious, it's not a movie." "I'm not iconic, I think Ukraine is iconic," Zelenskyy said. "Ukraine is the heart of Europe...[the] world can't lose this something special," he added.

384.title: Apple halts all product sales in Russia, days after Ukraine Vice PM's request
384.article_body: Apple has paused sale of its iPhone and other products in Russia, days after Ukraine's Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov wrote to Apple CEO Tim Cook. Apple said state-controlled news outlets RT and Sputnik are no longer available on the App Store outside Russia. It has also stopped live traffic updates on Apple Maps in Ukraine as a safety measure.

385.title: Newborn girl's body with umbilical cord found in garbage dump in Gurugram
385.article_body: A newborn girl's body was found in garbage dump in Gurugram's Sector 52. Incident came to light when a passerby spotted body and alerted security guard. Security guard said body was wrapped in "blood-soaked cloth". Police said an umbilical cord was still attached to body. "It will become clear if the infant was stillborn after the autopsy," an officer said.

386.title: Some people say Putin has cancer, others say he has brain fog from COVID: Pelosi
386.article_body: During an interview, US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said, "I've talked to heads of state who have met with Russian President Vladimir Putin...Some say he has cancer and some people say brain fog from COVID-19. Other people just think he's a complete raging bully." Pelosi said this after she was asked if "something's wrong with Vladimir Putin".

387.title: 2 realtors shot dead in Telangana; police suspect business rivalry
387.article_body: Two realtors were shot dead in Telangana's Ranga Reddy district on Tuesday. The locals found a Mahindra Scorpio SUV from which blood was oozing out and alerted the police. One of the victims had died on the spot while the other succumbed to injuries during treatment. The police said it appeared to be a dispute arising out of business rivalry.

388.title: India reports 7,554 new COVID-19 cases; over 600 higher than yesterday
388.article_body: India has reported 7,554 new COVID-19 cases and 223 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 6,915 cases and 180 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 85,680, while the death toll in the country reached 5,14,246. Over 4.2 crore people have recovered so far.

389.title: Naxal killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada
389.article_body: A Naxal carrying a reward of ₹3 lakh on his head was killed in an encounter with the security personnel in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada district on Tuesday, a senior official said. The encounter took place between the DRG and Naxals in the forest near Tumkapal village. Following the encounter, police recovered a pistol, 5 kg IED, books and other materials.

390.title: Form special teams to identify govt teachers taking private tuitions: HC to TN govt
390.article_body: Madras HC's Madurai Bench directed Tamil Nadu government to form special teams to identify government teachers taking private tuitions or running private businesses. HC was hearing a government teacher's plea against dismissal of her request for transfer to another district. Common numbers must be provided for parents and students to file complaints regarding misconducts by teachers, HC directed.

391.title: I get to live beautiful things with you: Hailey on Justin's on 28th b'day
391.article_body: Model Hailey Bieber wished her husband, singer Justin Bieber, on his 28th birthday. Taking to Instagram, Hailey shared a few pictures with her husband and wrote, "Happy birthday my baby...there are a lot of amazing and beautiful things about this life, but the most beautiful part is that I get to live it with you. I love you...here's to 28."

392.title: Airbnb CEO says US sanctions affecting firm's Russian operations
392.article_body: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky has said US sanctions on Russian banks have affected its ability to operate within the country. He added that a lot of their business will probably be halted "from the inability to be able to pay". Chesky also said that "all things are on the table right now" with regard to voluntarily limiting Airbnb's Russian operations.

393.title: 4 arrested for selling spurious ghee in Patanjali packs in Chandigarh
393.article_body: Chandigarh Police arrested three shopkeepers and a supplier for allegedly selling spurious ghee under packaging of popular brand Patanjali. Police raided the shops after the director of a company authorised by Patanjali to take action against shops selling spurious ghee under their name filed a complaint. The ghee was found to be made with a chemical unfit for human consumption.

394.title: Man sleeping on pavement killed after being run over by a tempo in Pune
394.article_body: A man sleeping on a pavement in Pune's Katraj was killed on Monday morning after the driver of a tempo ran the vehicle over him while on reverse. The police had arrested the accused, Sadashiv Chate, on Tuesday after going through CCTV camera footage. However, the driver was released on bail the same day by a local court, police said.

395.title: Naseem Shah added to Pakistan squad for 1st Test against Australia
395.article_body: Pakistan's 19-year-old pacer Naseem Shah, who was originally named as a reserve, has been included in the squad for their first Test against Australia after Haris Rauf was ruled out as he returned positive for COVID-19. Earlier, Faheem Ashraf and Hasan Ali were ruled out due to injuries, with Iftikhar Ahmed and Mohammad Wasim Jr being added to the squad.

396.title: Man stabbed to death after fight between 2 groups at Delhi gym
396.article_body: A man was allegedly stabbed to death at a gym in Delhi's Paharganj after a fight broke out between two groups. "There was an incident of a fight inside a gym between two boys, who also called their families," police said giving details. "The fight got aggravated and one party attacked the other with a knife killing one," they added.

397.title: Online forum, man booked over posts against HC judge in Bengaluru
397.article_body: The Bengaluru Police registered a case against an online forum Mangalore Muslims and Ateeq Shariff for allegedly posting against a High Court judge who is hearing the hijab case. The Facebook posts were derogatory and cast aspersions on the independence of the judge, the police said. Earlier, Kannada actor Chetan Kumar Ahimsa was arrested for posting against the same judge.

398.title: 80-year-old man lights his own pyre, dies in Nagpur
398.article_body: An 80-year-old man reportedly killed himself by lighting his own pyre in Nagpur. According to family of the deceased, identified as Atmaram Motiram Thawkar, he had a trachea surgery in 2006 from which he never fully recovered. Based on initial probe, police said Thawkar performed puja at a village temple and then built a pyre in a field using firewood.

399.title: Police scale wall to rescue woman, kids locked by her husband in Gujarat
399.article_body: Gujarat Police scaled walls of house to rescue woman and her children who had been locked by woman's husband. The husband reportedly locked them up after woman insisted on attending the last rites of her grandfather. Reports said husband also threatened to attack them with sharp objects. Woman asked for help from balcony. Police then reached woman's room through balcony.

400.title: I lost 7-kg weight during South Africa tour due to infection: Shreyas Iyer
400.article_body: Batter Shreyas Iyer has revealed that he lost 7-kg weight during India's tour of South Africa in December-January. "I had a very bad stomach infection at the start of the year when we were in South Africa.  Basically, whatever I was eating, it was coming out. It was one of the worst phases of my life," Iyer said.
